Articles.Content:
Since 1.2 came out, I have launched CKAN many times and observed a long list of mods that aren't yet updated for 1.2. I considered playing stock KSP and even went so far as to making a thread asking how to easily get the game back to vanilla. Ultimately, I just decided against it and went and played something else. I did not realize it right away, but going off to play another game instead of stock KSP caused me to gain a greater appreciation for how much better KSP becomes, for me, when mods are added into the mix.

I'll admit that over time, once all the mods are installed and working, it becomes easy to forget how integral to my enjoyment of KSP they are. As a result, I find myself frustrated when mods are not instantly updated and ready to go for the newest version of KSP. But after some maturity of thought, realizing that the mods I use now are what make me want to continue playing KSP renew my appreciation for them.

I wanted to say thank you to the modding community in general and for all the development you folks do for your mods. Whether it's quality of life mods, mods that add features, mods that add parts, and so on...I am confident I can safely speak for many in the community when I say I appreciate the hard work you put in, usually on a voluntary basis, to make KSP more enjoyable for others (and hopefully yourselves). 

Here's to many days going forward of the KSP mod community continuing to thrive!

Edited October 14, 2016 by Bandus

Me too!

Thanks all of you wonderful modders for your hard work!

Hear hear!

We love you folks, and what you do..

May the road rise up to meet you.
May the wind always be at your back.
May the sun shine warm upon your face,
and rains fall soft upon your fields.
